Seismic Behavior of Buildings Located on Slopes - An Analytical Study and Some Observations From Sikkim Earthquake of September 18, 2011

The focus of the analytical study on the seismic behavior of buildings located on slopes and the observations from the Sikkim Earthquake of September 18, 2011, was to examine the dynamic characteristics and seismic behavior of hill buildings using modal, linear, and nonlinear time history analyses. The study aimed to understand the peculiar seismic behavior of hill buildings due to their irregular and unsymmetrical structural configurations on hill slopes. The findings of the analytical study were corroborated by observations during damage surveys after the Sikkim earthquake.
